description: Ms. codex. Title from inscription on fol. 1a. Physical description: 25 lines per page. Written in medium small script in black ink with use of red. European paper with watermark. Occasional note, some in Turkish and Persian. Magic square on fol. 1a. Quinions. Two labels pasted on the upper cover, with inscription in Arabic script, reading respectively: "Ḥ 34" and 172. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥ 960". Origin: The copy is not dated. Probably 12-13th/18-19th century.
author: Sanāmī, ʻUmar ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAwaḍ.
abstract: Careful copy of two texts, one on iḥtisāb, the other on faith.
contents: 2. fol. 77b-94b: al-Risālah al-Ruknīyah fi kalimat al-shahādah / Rukn al-Dīn ʻUbayd Allāh ibn Muḥammad al-Samarqandī. -- Mach, R. Yahuda, no. 2368.
extent: 75 leaves: paper ; 203 x 132 (164 x 80) mm. bound to 205 x 135 mm.
title: Kitāb Niṣāb al-iḥtisāb wa al-Risālah al-Ruknīyah fi kalimat al-shahādah
provenance: From the books of Aḥmad Najīb (fol. 1a). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: سنامي، عمر بن محمد بن عوض
subject: Muhtasib
binding note: Quaterbound with flap in marbled paper and golden-brown leather. Dark-orange dyed paper pastedowns.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
